comment: Class used to handle comparison logic (used primarily for sorting Collection objects)
commentblock: <div class="description">	<ul class="blockList">		<li class="blockList">			<div class="comments"><!-- comment --><pre>Class used to handle comparison logic (used primarily for sorting Collection objects)</pre></div>			<hr />		</li>	</ul></div>
commenthtml: Class used to handle comparison logic (used primarily for sorting Collection objects)
inlinecomment: ' Class used to handle comparison logic (used primarily for sorting Collection objects)

methods.label: compare
methods.comment: Main function that does the comparison. Only needs to code for natural before/after. The outer function will reverse the result if the Comparator is instantiated as descending order or Collection has been reversed.
methods.codesample:
%REM
The following code is Comparator.compareAscDesc.
%END REM
Public Function compareAscDesc(source as Variant, target as Variant, collReversed as Boolean) as Integer
    compareAscDesc = compare(source, target)
    If (m_isDescending Xor collreversed) Then Return 0 - compareAscDesc Else Return compareAscDesc
End Function
methods.signature: Public Function compare(source As Variant, target As Variant) As Integer
methods.commentblock: <div class="description">	<ul class="blockList">		<li class="blockList">			<div class="comments"><!-- comment --><pre>Main function that does the comparison. Only needs to code for natural before/after. The outer function will reverse the result if the Comparator is instantiated as descending order or Collection has been reversed.</pre></div>			<hr />		</li>	</ul></div>

methods.label: compareAscDesc
methods.comment:
Compares source and target, returning -1 if source is before target, 0 if they are the same, 1 if source is after target.
The value is reversed (so -1 changed to 1, 1 changed to -1) if:
- Comparator is descending, but Collection is not reversed
- Comparator is ascending, but Collection is reversed
methods.codesample:
%REM
The following code is abbreviated code from Collection.getIndex. It compares each element against the value being checked, and if it matches, returns the current index.
%END REM
Public Function getIndex(checkValue as Variant) as Variant
    ForAll elem in Me.p_content)
        If (Me.Comparator.compareAscDesc(checkValue, elem, Me.p_isCollReversed) = 0) Then Return ListTag(elem)
    End ForAll
End Function
methods.argumentsuffix: (source As Variant, target As Variant, collReversed As Boolean)
methods.signature: Public Function compareAscDesc(source As Variant, target As Variant, collReversed As Boolean) As Integer

methods.label: equals
methods.comment:
Function to determine if two values are determined to be identical.
Used by remove, replace, and contains functions
methods.codesample:
%REM
The following code is Collection.getIndex().
%END REM
ForAll elem in p_content
    If (Me.comparator.equals(checkValue, elem)) Then Return ListTag(elem)
End ForAll
